sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"岸"之意。
means: bank ： 多指有一定坡度的河岸、湖岸或堤岸。
beach ： 指倾斜度小，被海、湖或河水冲刷而有沙或卵石积存的地方。
coast ： 地理学上的名词，专指被视为边界的沿海陆地的尽头。
shore ： 指紧靠大湖泊或海洋的陆地边缘或靠海的休养地。
seaside ： 尤指疗养地、游览地区的海边。

word_mean: 库：供他人将来应用的人体材料或组织的贮存供应处，如血库，骨库，眼库，人乳库，皮库等

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old Norse bakki, of Germanic origin; related to bench. The senses 'set of similar things in sloping rows' and 'tier of oars' are from French banc, of the same ultimate origin
late 15th cent. (originally denoting a money dealer's table): from French banque or Italian banca, from medieval Latin banca, bancus, of Germanic origin; related to bank and bench

entry.def: A bank is an institution where people or businesses can keep their money.

example.ex: Which bank offers you the service that best suits your financial needs?...
example.tran: 哪家银行提供的服务最适合您的理财需求？
我在银行有1万英镑的存款。

entry.tran: 银行营业厅；银行办事处
entry.def: A bank is a building where a bank offers its services.
If you bank money, you pay it into a bank.

example.ex: Once you have registered your particulars with an agency and it has banked your cheque, the process begins.
example.tran: 一旦在某个代理行登记了详细信息并由它将支票存入银行，这一程序就开始了。

entry.tran: 与（银行）有业务来往；在（银行）有账户
entry.def: If you bank with a particular bank, you have an account with that bank.

example.ex: My husband has banked with the  Co-op since before the war.
example.tran: 我丈夫自战前以来就在合作银行有户头。

entry.def: You use bank to refer to a store of something. For example, a blood bank is a store of blood that is kept ready for use.

example.ex: ...Britain's National Police Computer, one of the largest data banks in the world.
example.tran: 英国国家警务计算机系统，世界上最大的数据库之一

entry.tran: 斥巨资；花费大笔的钱；倾家荡产
entry.def: If you say that the cost of something will not break the bank, you mean that it will not cost a large sum of money.

example.ex: Prices starting at £6 a bottle won't break the bank.
example.tran: 每瓶6英镑的起价不算太贵。

entry.def: The banks of a river, canal, or lake are the raised areas of ground along its edge.

example.ex: ...30 miles of new developments along both banks of the Thames.
example.tran: 泰晤士河两岸30英里的新开发区

example.ex: ...an old warehouse on the banks of a canal.
example.tran: 运河河畔的一座旧仓库

entry.def: A bank of ground is a raised area of it with a flat top and one or two sloping sides.

example.tran: 懒洋洋地躺在草埂上休息

entry.def: A bank of something is a long high mass of it.

example.ex: On their journey south they hit a bank of fog off the north-east coast of Scotland.
example.tran: 南行途中，他们在苏格兰东北海岸外遭遇了大雾。

entry.tran: （尤指机器、开关、仪表的）（一）排，（一）组
entry.def: A bank of things, especially machines, switches, or dials, is a row of them, or a series of rows.

example.ex: The typical laborer now sits in front of a bank of dials.
example.tran: 现如今，工人通常都是坐在一排仪表前。

entry.tran: （通常指飞机在改变方向时）倾斜飞行
entry.def: When an aircraft banks, one of its wings rises higher than the other, usually when it is changing direction.

example.ex: A plane took off and banked above the highway in front of him.
example.tran: 一架飞机起飞后在他前方的公路上空侧飞转向。

means.word_mean: 1. a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels the money into lending activities;

sentences.sentence: "he cashed a check at the bank"
"that bank holds the mortgage on my home"

means.word_mean: 2. sloping land (especially the slope beside a body of water);

sentences.sentence: "they pulled the canoe up on the bank"
"he sat on the bank of the river and watched the currents"

means.word_mean: 3. a supply or stock held in reserve for future use (especially in emergencies)
4. a building in which commercial banking is transacted;

sentences.sentence: "the bank is on the corner of Nassau and Witherspoon"

means.word_mean: 5. an arrangement of similar objects in a row or in tiers;
6. a container (usually with a slot in the top) for keeping money at home;
7. a long ridge or pile;
8. the funds held by a gambling house or the dealer in some gambling games;

sentences.sentence: "he tried to break the bank at Monte Carlo"

means.word_mean: 9. a slope in the turn of a road or track; the outside is higher than the inside in order to reduce the effects of centrifugal force
10. a flight maneuver; aircraft tips laterally about its longitudinal axis (especially in turning);

sentences.sentence: "the plane went into a steep bank"

means.word_mean: 1. tip laterally;

sentences.sentence: "the pilot had to bank the aircraft"

means.word_mean: 2. enclose with a bank;
3. do business with a bank or keep an account at a bank;

sentences.sentence: "Where do you bank in this town?"

means.word_mean: 4. act as the banker in a game or in gambling
5. be in the banking business
6. put into a bank account;
7. cover with ashes so to control the rate of burning;
8. have confidence or faith in;

Today, any data that is collected about us in one place or another — and for one reason or another — can be stored in a computer bank.
It can then be easily passed to other computer banks.

sentences.cn: 农民们在冬季堆积防雪林。

sentences.cn: 飞机陡然向左侧斜飞行。

jushi.english: New banks made appearance in the next two decades.
jushi.chinese: 新开的银行是在那以后20年中出现的。

jushi.english: He seated himself in the boat and began rowing towards the other bank.
jushi.chinese: 他坐进小船,开始划向对岸。

jushi.english: When the bank broke, many people were ruined.
jushi.chinese: 当银行倒闭时,许多人都跟着破产了。
